title: Local developer picks up Coca-Cola Amatil's Adelaide bottling site
text:
Coca-Cola Amatil has sold its historic former Thebarton bottling site in inner Adelaide to local developer Australasian Property Developments (APD) as well as two nearby smaller sites for a combined $37.3 million.

APD managing director Pep Rocca said he intended to draw income from the existing improvements in the short to medium term with longer-term plans to redevelop the 3.5 hectare Port Road site - known as Lot 2 - into a mix of commercial and residential use.

Coca-Cola was bottled at Thebarton for 66 years. Michele Mossop

A second smaller adjoining site was sold to industrial supplier Jetwave Pty Ltd. A third 9500 square metre site sold last year and will be developed into affordable housing by Anglicare South Australia.

Jetwave managing director Roy Seco said the company would use its newly acquired site for industrial activities including the manufacturing and importing of high-pressure cleaning equipment and industrial wet and dry vacuum cleaners.

Coca-Cola did not disclose the individual selling prices.
description: Australasian Property Developments has longer-term plans to redevelop the 5.2 hectare site into a mix of commercial and residential use.
